snippet: The best labor numbers since the Great Recession contrast with weaknesses and risks that need to be addressed in 2015.
abstract: Editorial welcomes exceptional strides in the labor market in 2014, but warns progress highlights important, ongoing weaknesses and risks; notes employment growth continues to lag behind population growth, and that December increase was largely concentrated in low-wage work; calls on new Republican majority to refrain from battles that could turn basic acts of governance into serial fiscal crises.
lead_paragraph: The best labor numbers since the Great Recession contrast with weaknesses and risks that need to be addressed in 2015.

headline.print_headline: Toward a Better Job Market in the New Year
